definition: diagram of cosmological scheme/Yin-Yang symbol ☯
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
extremely/pole (geography, physics)/utmost/top
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek
philosophical book by Song dynasty scholar Zhou Dunyi 周敦頤|周敦颐[Zhou1 Dun1 yi2], starting from an interpretation of the Book of Changes

sentences.english: This paper aims at setting forth opinions on the issue of the author of Taiji Tu.
sentences.chinese: 本文旨在对《太极图》的作者问题提出个人的看法。

sentences.english: These levels refer to the different levels in the model of Taiji symbol.
sentences.chinese: 这个层级较高，是指太极图模式的层级性。

sentences.english: We take the Diagram of the Supreme Ultimate as the mark of our Wushu Association.
sentences.chinese: 我们用太极图作我们武术协会的标志。

sentences.english: We look at the "Book of Changes" in this beautiful Taiji diagram.
sentences.chinese: 我们看一下《易经》的这个美丽的太极图。

definition: heaven and earth/yin and yang

four divisions (of the twenty-eight constellations 二十八宿[er4 shi2 ba1 xiu4] of the sky into groups of seven mansions), namely: Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2], White Tiger 白虎[Bai2 hu3], Vermilion Bird 朱雀[Zhu1 que4], Black Tortoise 玄武[Xuan2 wu3]
time immemorial/origin of the universe/the world
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor, trad. 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping and writing
eight-trigram battle array/(fig.) mystifying tactics
the Eternal Wheel of life in Buddhism
primordial spirit/fundamental essence of life
Pangu (creator of the universe in Chinese mythology)
the Absolute or Supreme Ultimate, the source of all things according to some interpretations of Chinese mythology
Lingbao county level city in Sanmenxia 三門峽|三门峡[San1 men2 xia2], Henan
Taixu (famed Buddhist monk, 1890-1947)
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
mist

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky

lotus seat
